intro: Senecio doria var. canescens, commonly known as the hairy senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, gray-green foliage and yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
